indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Number of successful elections (by-elections) conducted Number and type of capacity support to NEC Number of PPRC activities in electoral process Number of CSO election monitors deployed and civic education outreach nationwide Number of monitoring visits by the IMC nationwide Number of sensitization campaign on violence prevention conducted by the CSO; number of ad hoc mediation activities conducted by traditional authorities Evaluation and lessons learned reports Boundary delimitation exercise initiated Number of voter ID card printing capacity in place for NEC and boundary delimitation report

baseline.comment: 2012 Presidential, Parliamentary and local elections assessed, election conflicts managed and voter turnout was very high Existing electoral systems require review; national outreach in civic education messages broadcast on national and community radios

target.comment: Sierra Leone EMBs has the capacity to conduct independent elections

actual.comment: In 2014 UNDP enabled the Commission to conduct a radio sensitization program in the Western Region to raise awareness among the electorate and for training on radio communications for the PPRC Outreach Officer and the Spokesperson. In view of the upcoming elections, PPRC now has a detailed capacity building plan for capacity building of the Commission. The commission communication capacity was strengthened through the installation of broadband internet connectivity for the PPRC regional offices and Freetown office. The country now has a system of monitoring on political party performance which has been produced and discussed with Political parties and other stakeholders By end of 2014, NEC has successfully conducted 129 elections as follows: 5 Parliamentary and 7 local council bye-elections, 14 Paramount Chief and 91 Village Head elections

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Coverage of skills and business development services targeting youth (number of participants, â€˜graduationâ€™ rates); number of placements for graduates of vocational training programmes(disaggregated by zone, district, region, national) Number of Business Development centers and number of CAPS functional Number of Agribusiness centers operational and number of functional TVET institutions Number of active clients aged 15-35 (m/f) that have used financial services Number of young people actively involved in youth councils (disaggregated by female/male Number of agribusiness centers operational and number of functional TVET institutions Level of operational capacity support to SABI and the level of SABI extension to the provinces

baseline.comment: NAYCOM established and functional; Youth Employment Strategy formulated; 5 Business Development Services centres established and functional 150 graduates placed for 3 months internship in 19 private, public and development sectors as employers 150,000 male and female used financial services in 2011

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: - # of climate change resilience plan for Guma reservoir established - # of people accessing safe water supply services at projected climate change affected communities - % change of key decision-makers with limited knowledge of climate change impacts or adaptation responses - Number of strategic documents produced and used in tackling climate change issues in the country

baseline.comment: - No climate change adaptation concerns and actions mainstreamed within the Guma Reservoir Management process - Zero additional people provided with access to safe water supply services at projected climate change affected target communities - Baseline capacity assessment to be undertaken at project onset

target.comment: 1 climate change resilience plan for Guma reservoir established

actual.comment:
One (1) climate resilience plan for Guma supported
Four (4) strategic documents were supported in 2015. UNDP supported the development of the Intentionally National Determined Contribution (INDCs), position papers on natural resource management for the constitutional review, the Natural Resource Charter Benchmarking report and The State of Environment Report all informing key national environmental situations and priorities for future interventions

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: - % national coverage of climate/weather and hydrological monitoring infrastructure - # of development frameworks that incorporate any EWS/CI products such as risk maps or climate change predictions into long-term planning - # of tailored climate products for specific sectors - # of market research survey on how household/national required early warning advisories, both supporting targeted weather/climate service delivery - # increase of certified meteorologist & 25 observers

baseline.comment: - 20 % national coverage for climate/weather monitoring - 0 development frameworks that incorporate any EWS/CI products such as risk maps or climate change predictions into long-term planning - 0 tailored climate products developed - 0 market research survey on how household/national required early warning advisories, both supporting targeted weather/climate service delivery - 2 certified professional meteorologist & 25 observers

target.comment: - Establishment of PIU - Conduct of baseline data survey

actual.comment: Recruitment of PM & establishment of PIU

target.comment: - 1 market research survey on how household/national required early warning advisories, both supporting targeted weather/climate service delivery - 2 SLMD personnel enrolled to be trained as certified meteorologist

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: - % Change in efficiency of cook stove technology - # of policies developed that are supported of BET application - # of certified sustainable charcoal production businesses developed as influenced by the strengthened policy and institutional frameworks for BET application - # of efficient charcoal kiln, industrial stoves and institutional furnaces/stoves being used on a daily basis by households in targeted areas

baseline.comment: - 5-30% efficient cook stoves technologies - No policies and legal frameworks supportive of BET applications - No certified sustainable charcoal production businesses developed - Zero installed efficient charcoal kiln, industrial stoves and institutional furnaces/stoves being used on a daily basis by households in targeted areas

target.comment: - 3 policies and legal frameworks supportive of BET applications - 5 sustainable charcoal production businesses developed as influenced by the strengthened policy and institutional frameworks for BET application

iati-activity.title: Support to UN Clinic Essential Services in Sierra Leone
iati-activity.description: Funding for the UN Clinic in Sierra Leone to maintain the required medical capacity and level of Preparedness until the end of 2015 to ensure UN system's duty of care to its personnel (and Families)
